name: California Public Interest Research Group ðŸ’™
description:
CALPIRG Students is a student-run, student-funded nonprofit at eight of the UCs that, through grassroots organizing and advocacy, fights to protect our environment, make college more affordable, and reinvigorate our democracy.

 

CALPIRG stands for California Public Interest Research Group, fighting against private/special interests who have a lot more money, but we have the people power. With over forty years of grassroots organizing experience, there is no other nonprofit like CALPIRG Students.

 

CALPIRG has advocated for changes we all now take for granted, such as mandatory seat belts in cars and nutrition labels on food. In just the past couple of years, we've committed California to 100% clean electricity by 2045 (we started the '100%' motto everyone now knows is referring to renewable energy), committed UC Berkeley to 100% clean energy (the first major institution to do so), passed a statewide bag ban (we were known as the 'bag people'), registered thousands of students to vote, and much more.

 

We're the largest student group in California with dues-paying members, so we're very supported! As our track record implies, we’re a very goals-orientated nonprofit. We have different campaigns (or teams) within our organization that have specific goals. Every semester, we have a variety of campaigns that we organize on, usually focusing on environmental conservation, student affordability, and/or consumer protection.

 

If you are interested in learning how to make a campaign plan, build grassroots support, lobby your elected officials, and make real change, come check us out and see what we can accomplish together!
summary: CALPIRG Students is a student-run, student-funded nonprofit at eight of the UCs that, through grassroots organizing and advocacy, fights to protect our environment, make college more affordable, and reinvigorate our democracy.
